column1: The Biden transition team has started planning and a top priority will be getting COVID-19 under control. Learn more about the President and Vice President elects’ priorities and then sign up to get updates and stay involved: https://t.co/B1fTuubUFg https://t.co/ubE1rhRZW8

Americans shouldn’t have to learn to live with death. We need a president who will take responsibility and lead not refuse to take responsibility for the devastation of this pandemic. #COVID19 #TeamJoe
The Trump-Pence Administration’s COVID response has been an utter failure. It’s that simple.
I hope that President and Mrs. Trump get well soon. This is a reminder to all of us that COVID-19 is a dangerous virus. We encourage everyone to continue to stay safe and wear a mask.
President Trump’s inability to respond to COVID has been a disaster. And it has cost tens of thousands of American lives.

Even though Donald Trump knew how deadly/dangerous COVID-19 was he spent most of the year lying to the American people and intentionally misleading them about the grave risks the virus posed to their health and their loved ones. This is truly egregious. https://t.co/cG0E8OdkY3

Thanks to everyone who helped w/the successful (socially distant) lit drop today! Our volunteers work hard and are committed.— And we even had organized labor come out and support us! To join another #WoA event visit https://t.co/94dvYEi5YO to volunteer! #Gratitude #TeamCoons https://t.co/JOODTUWYIi

Millions are unemployed and on the brink of homelessness; #COVID19 cases are approaching 5.3 Million and yet the GOP adjourned Senate until Sep. without agreeing to Dem demands for a bill that will sustain Americans for the long haul. This is unconscionable. #BidenHarris2020

We will pass a stimulus package that provides the resources and financial relief families and state/local governments need to uphold and sustain Americans beyond the temporary fixes President Trump has offered. We will get through this together that I promise you. #Coronavirus

They then stifled medical experts and scientists who tried desperately to help our nation avoid this outcome.   Please know that although Congress has not yet passed another round of much needed #COVID19 aid I am working tirelessly with my Democratic colleagues.

We have once again reached a grim milestone as the global leader of new Coronavirus cases with 5 million cases nationally. This is truly tragic given the Trump Administration spent critical time denying this pandemic as a hoax.. https://t.co/aoJ3vg2Aes

If you didn't get a chance please take a moment to read my and Ray Brescia's OpEd in @thehill on how Congress can-- and must-- prevent #homelessness in the #COVID19 Pandemic >> https://t.co/RLQ0UhxgdM

I joined my colleagues in challenging the Trump Admin to investigate and remedy reports of retaliation towards #BIPOC workers who raise #COVID19 concerns in the workplace. Our workers are the backbone of our economy and shouldn't have to work in fear! https://t.co/5HPOeZdP7G

Today I called for the @NIH to prioritize a research plan to assess the short/longterm effects of #COVID19 on our children. There is still so much we don’t understand about this virus and we must make smart informed decisions about school reopenings that protect our youths.

Delawareans and people across the US need #COVID19 relief immediately. Please know that I am fighting for you in the Senate so that you won’t have to struggle to make ends meet. I’m working w/@ewarren to stop corruption in the next bill and will ensure we overcome this together.

Team Coons was out and about in the field today putting up signs (safely and socially distant)!— Have you picked up your free yard sign yet? If not please visit https://t.co/srfkTLi16y -> “Act Now” to request one. Thank you for your continued support! #Dems2020 #Delaware #Vote https://t.co/P2IFFnu2Ud

#COVID19 has compounded economic disparities for Black/Brown Americans particularly around housing. I had a call w/Civil Rights + Housing leaders today to discuss bills I am supporting to alleviate this so that housing security is real for all Americans. https://t.co/0VBqZwgoHZ

Connections shouldn't determine your economic recovery from COVID-19. I'm proud to join @EWarren in introducing the CORE Act which ensures those that need federal aide the most receive it while also providing accountability for our taxpayers' dollars! https://t.co/PzFt6x7Rfs

I am a proud sponsor of the WORK NOW Act which will provide critical financial support to nonprofit organizations who dedicate their time to helping others. Before #COVID19 they were the ones lending a helping hand. Now it's our turn to return the favor. https://t.co/SivMA6zZIn

Tomorrow in the Senate we won’t be working on COVID-19 relief. We’ll be voting on yet another extreme right-wing anti-Obamacare judicial nominee.  If you like me have a problem with that let’s work together to take back the Senate this fall.

#COVID19 has devastated fisheries fisheries distributors and fisheries processors. @NOAA must give out the fishery disaster assistance fairly and ensure that small states like Delaware and Connecticut get our fair share  https://t.co/S02R4PFiHH

Widespread testing for #COVID19 is essential but we still don't have enough tests. @TomCarperforDE and I are calling on China to ease export restrictions on test kits and supplies. It's past time we got our health care heroes the resources they need.   https://t.co/0UGS8SX0Ie

It's absolutely ridiculous that Mitch McConnell has forced the Senate back into session this week *not to pass additional COVID relief* - but to confirm one of his former interns an unqualified 38 year old to a lifetime seat on the federal bench. https://t.co/Z9yLhsoljk

For too long the US has relied on other countries for pharmaceutical manufacturing. During #COVID19 it is our healthcare workers who are paying the steepest price. Investing in bio manufacturing vaccines and pandemic preparation needs to be a priority. https://t.co/KzsV4DtgyE

Dems fought to include another $25 billion for nationwide COVID-19 testing in addition to signifiant support for small businesses and health systems. We need a massive increase in our testing capacity to fully re-open our country safely. https://t.co/M15o7JnP8X https://t.co/kUbxBRBkX5

Whether or not you are infected or know someone who is infected the COVID-19 crisis will require a national response.   Each of us plays a vital role in flattening the curve through staying at home and social distancing. We will overcome this — together. https://t.co/rrniaCKwVn
First - the big picture: This bill sends $150 billion to hospitals and health care workers who are caring for tens of thousands of Americans with COVID-19.

Last night I voted to pass the largest relief package in American history to respond to the coronavirus and it passed with unanimous bipartisan support. It will soon become law and deliver immediate relief to hospitals businesses and families in need. https://t.co/jtPmksMWUA

We are close to passing the largest bill in American history to support our hospitals workers families communities small businesses and more in response to the coronavirus.  We have to get this done get it right and then all of us need to listen to the health experts.

I’m here in Washington still negotiating with Democrats and Republicans so we can pass a major piece of legislation to help families and small businesses deal with the economic crisis created by the coronavirus. We need to act now and put families and small businesses first.

Yesterday we passed the Families First Coronavirus Response Act bipartisan legislation which includes much-needed measures like free testing paid sick leave for many Americans support for unemployment and nutrition programs and more.

Many of us are feeling rightfully concerned about the threat COVID-19 poses to our health our loved ones and our livelihoods. During these trying times I want to keep you updated on what we're doing in Congress to address this crisis & keep our families and communities safe.

I just voted to pass the Families First Coronavirus Response Act which provides free testing and expands paid leave unemployment insurance and more.  It’s a good important start. But there’s more work to do. We need to pass additional aid ASAP  https://t.co/9UMCpitToH
Among other things I’m working to include my bill with @SherrodBrown to strengthen our safety net programs for the most vulnerable Americans in the next legislative package to respond to #COVIDー19

I’m in Washington ready to vote *right now* to pass the #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act to provide free testing expand unemployment and nutrition aid and more. There’s no time to waste because we can’t stop there.

I'm calling on President Trump to allow for a special enrollment period under the #ACA to allow more Americans including Delawareans to sign up for coverage and help mitigate the spread of COVID-19. https://t.co/UbvTW5Qemj

Coronavirus is a serious public health challenge but the President and his Administration seem more concerned about how it impacts Trump’s re-election campaign. The American people deserve better.   This should be about public safety not politics. https://t.co/myuryZ8bPA
